paper.title: Unconditional Security Against Memory-Bounded Adversaries
paper.abstract: We propose a private-key cryptosystem and a protocol for key agreement by public discussion that are unconditionally secure based on the sole assumption that an adversaryu0027s memory capacity is limited. No assumption about her computing power is made. The scenario assumes that a random bit string of length slightly larger than the adversaryu0027s memory capacity can be received by all parties. The random bit string can for instance be broadcast by a satellite or over an optical network, or transmitted over an insecure channel between the communicating parties. The proposed schemes require very high bandwidth but can nevertheless be practical.
